reviews.text: I was coming to Denver for a conference, and had made reservations at the conference hotel (a Doubletree). They gave my room up to someone else (!!) and had to go to the Ramada. Now, pushing aside my disappointment at being somewhere other than where I had booked, my stay at the Ramada was not bad.
reviews.title: The other reviews are way too harsh...still, not my favorite

reviews.text: I was greeted at the front desk by the manager. She used my name, and said they were expecting me. I arrived too late for room service, but she provided me complimentary snacks from their break room, and provided a coupon for free breakfast. If I chose to stay for the rest of my stay at Ramada, she offered me a fantastic rate at the Ramada.
reviews.title: a very scary place

reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning was quite nice. Truthfully, the best part was one server. She walked past me carrying a pitcher of dark liquid. I asked her if that was iced tea, because there was none on the bar. She said it wasn't iced tea. Five minutes later, she re-appeared at my table with a glass of just-made iced tea, just for me. Completely made my day!
reviews.title: Still needs some updating

likes.disliked: — room temperature control and poor internet location and street noise (highway)

reviews.text: So, service at the hotel was near-perfect. I was very happy with the Ramada.
reviews.title: Definitely not worth the money! Poor management and run down rooms!
Terrible
reviews.text: Now, I am choosing to NOT stay at the Ramada for the rest of my stay. This change is solely because it is simply more convenient to have a room in the conference hotel so that you can wash up before you head to the airport.
